meanings.definition: The act of becoming sly or cunning.
meanings.sent1: After reading many detective stories, she started to develop foxings in her behavior.
meanings.sent2: The foxings of the cat were evident as it quietly stalked its prey.
meanings.sent3: The foxings of the young boy trying to sneak a cookie from the jar were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her foxings in negotiation made her a formidable opponent in business.
meanings.sent5: The foxings of the fox were so clever that it outsmarted all the other animals in the forest.

meanings.definition: Stains or discolorations on paper caused by mold or mildew.
meanings.sent1: The old book had foxings on its pages from being stored in a damp basement.
meanings.sent2: She carefully removed the foxings from the valuable document to preserve its integrity.
meanings.sent3: The foxings on the map made it look like a treasure map from a pirate story.
meanings.sent4: The foxings on the letter gave it an antique feel, adding to its charm.
meanings.sent5: The foxings on the painting were a testament to its age and history.

meanings.definition: The process of aging or weathering, especially in relation to books or documents.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the foxings on the parchment gave it a sense of ancient wisdom.
meanings.sent2: The librarian carefully monitored the foxings on the rare manuscripts to prevent further damage.
meanings.sent3: The foxings on the old map made it look like it had been on many adventures.
meanings.sent4: The foxings on the cover of the book hinted at the stories within.
meanings.sent5: The foxings on the document told a story of its own, of years gone by and secrets kept.
